wikipedia_page.main: John Thomas Nicholas (26 November 1910 – 14 February 1977) was an English professional footballer who played as a wing half.

response: Derby were one of several clubs to close down after the outbreak of World War II but restarted in the early 1940s, in part due to the persistence of Jack Nicholas and Jack Webb. Aided by the recruitment of Raich Carter and Peter Doherty, who had both been stationed in Loughborough during the war, Derby were one step ahead of the opposition when competitive football resumed with the 1946 FA Cup and won their first major trophy with a 4–1 victory over Charlton Athletic.

link_mentions.page: List of Derby County F.C. records and statistics

response: In 1939, he made a shock decision to retire from professional football at a young age to become a policeman in Huddersfield. In 1942, he played in the Inter-Allied Services Cup, a wartime football competition involving British serviceman, police and firefighters. Other members of the police squad were Jack Nicholas, Bob Brocklebank, and Tom Smith.
